kitchen today I want to share with you a recipe 
for garlic noodles and if you're thinking that

sounds really good let me tell you it is it's 
better than it sounds it's sort of like the

Asian version of garlic bread it's buttery its 
garlicky its satisfying and it's got that chewy

egg noodles in it mmm so good now I had this dish 
dish years ago when I was in San Francisco and at

the time I didn't know that it was a famous thing 
that San Francisco was known for it started out

at a seafood restaurant that had it as a side 
and it became so popular that other restaurants

started copying them and then people on the 
internet started copying them and so recently I

was reminded of it and I discovered that hey what 
do you know it's famous so I wanted to share this

dish with you because barbecue season is coming 
up and it's actually a really good side dish to

go with a large amount of meat or seafood and 
so you know if you have things on the grill even

steamed some seafood this is a great side so good 
in fact that you may end up just eating the side

who needs anything else when you've got a bowl of 
garlic noodles in front of you alright let's get

started so let's talk noodles so for this you 
want to use egg noodles or at the very least

wheat noodles something that's chewy okay so I'm 
using these which are precooked egg noodles and

you want to go fat you want fat noodles for these 
I mean then we'll work too but it's better if it's

fat trust me and the weight that I'm giving you 
is the weight of the noodles already cooked if

you're using something that is uncooked like the 
fresh noodles and you need to boil you're gonna

you need a little bit less so just check the 
written recipe for my recommendation for that

if you're using something like this you may have 
a bit of a hard time to get it to become unstuck

plop that out and what you want to do is just 
kind of like slowly pull them apart trying your

best to not break the noodles if you break them 
a little bit it's okay the noodles are quite

long I tried once to just dip them in hot water 
like give them a quick blanch before I stir-fry

them and I found that because these are already 
cooked even that like 2-3 second dip in boiling

water was too much like it it made them not as 
chewy so I like to not cook these before I put

them in the wok so that's good enough and then 
as you can see it's really oily they tossed the

noodles in oil to prevent them from sticking 
I don't want all this oil in my dish so I'm

gonna give this a rinse under cold water just 
to get most of the oil off it's probably not

good oil for you it's probably the cheapest oil 
they could possibly find that's it and you can

feel right away it's not greasy on your fingers 
anymore and I move it out of the colander just

because I find that there's some water still 
trapped in the part where there are no holes

and so this way I make sure they're dry you don't 
want a lot of water going into the wok and then

steaming them up being soggy okay now let's get 
the sauce so the garlic I like to pound it in the

morning pestle because it's faster and also it 
like squeezes out all the garlicky goodness it

gets to be this creamy garlic paste it's good 
but mincing is totally fine after a couple of

smashes I can peel the skin off easily just like 
that so easy and you want a lot of garlic because

as of afterall we're making garlic noodles you 
can even put the whole head if you want now I'm

just gonna pound this into a rough paste it don't 
need to be liquefied but just no more large doses

okay yeah something like that something that will 
distribute well and easily into the noodles okay

so now the sauce I've got a tablespoon of oyster 
sauce here and I'm using good quality oyster sauce

something that has moister extract as the first 
ingredient and then to this I'm gonna add some

fish sauce of course and this is the trifecta of 
umami I'm gonna add golden Mountain sauce now you

can also just use regular soy sauce you can also 
use Maggi seasoning I have done it with both and

I really feel like golden mouth is the best but 
it's it's minor so just use whatever you have

apart from that one of the key ingredients 
is Parmesan cheese so this is gonna give the

noodles a little bit of a creaminess extra umami 
helps to sort of bind everything together so

that it's not just like slick oily noodles and 
I'm gonna just finely grate with my microplane

here so that the cheese can be distributed more 
evenly more easily if you use a big hole grater

then you just get big chunks and I'll just save 
this for my snack so I don't grate myself and

that's it let's get cooking now before we start 
cooking let me tell you about today's sponsor

everything in the description below so I've got a 
wok here I'm going to add some butter I've got my

heat on low not low enough apparently this wok 
I'm gonna turn it off now because this burner

gets really hot and I'm also gonna add a little 
bit of olive oil and I do a combination because

I find that if you use butter alone which you 
can but once the noodles cool down a little bit

it becomes a little bit gallopping and sticky 
because butter hardens when it cools so this is

something you're gonna like let's sit on the table 
and might get to room temperature adding oil will

sort of keep everything supple and lubricated it's 
like a little moisturizer okay and then the garlic

goes in and you want to start on low heat because 
you want the garlic thyme - slowly infuse into the

butter without browning and you want to have all 
your ingredients ready because this will go fast

so give this you want the heat to be low enough 
and you can do this for like a good three four

minutes because you want all that garlic to really 
soften its like garlic simmering in butter mm-hmm

and I use olive oil you don't have to you can just 
use any neutral flavored oil but I think olive oil

flavor works in this who loves garlic raise your 
hands I bet all of you because otherwise why are

you watching so it's been about three minutes the 
garlic looks soften and I can really smell it in

the air I am now going to go in with the noodles 
and then I'm gonna turn up the heat because now I

just dumped a bunch of cold noodles in so you can 
really max it out now and then the sauce goes in

and you'll notice that I didn't add any sugar 
like I normally do and I just don't feel like

this recipe meets it now you want to give it a 
good toss actually I'm going to use tongs much

more sensible and seriously all you're trying to 
do at this point is distribute the sauce and keep

the noodles up because they're cold and then 
you are done how easy is that if you're doing

this for like a barbecue you can prep the sauce 
the garlic everything in advance so that on the

day you have so little to do you can even cook 
all the garlic into the sauce and everything in

advance put it in a little container comes a day 
you turn on the wok pour your precooked sauce on

add the noodles and then you're done and that's it 
how easy is that I have to say when I made this at

home using a regular glass though that's not a 
glass of yes bath top so that's not an inferno

like this thing it does take a little while to 
get all the noodles heat it up now I've turned

off the heat now I'm going to add my Parmesan 
cheese oh yes and I turn off the heat because

I don't want the Parmesan cheese to the too hot 
and then start sizzling and burning stuck to the

pan I just want it to melt oh my god just look at 
that just look at that looks so good that Parmesan

cheese is so important it just adds that touch of 
creaminess and just binds the noodles together so

you're not just eating you know slippery oily 
noodles oh yes okay I don't even need to taste

this I've had this so many times but if it's 
your first time I highly recommend you taste

it so you can add a little bit more sauce 
if you need to maybe it needs a little salt

I'm so excited to eat it's like the first thing 
I'm eating all day now I like a little bit of

black pepper on top you don't have to oh yes 
it's also a nice visual and a little greenery

if you want green onions make everything 
look better okay let's be quick about this

because I'm hungry I'm just gonna eat it 
right off of this bowl that's not so good

Wow who needs anything else just eat a bowl 
of garlic noodles actually this reminds me

optional garnish I think adding a little bit of 
lemon like it's just a quick squeeze of lemon

you don't want this to be sour but that little 
bit of acid just kind of cuts the grease if you

will because it's so buttery but I think if 
you're gonna serve it just have some wedges

of lemon on the side that people can sprinkle 
all over it really brightens it up and it makes

it a little bit less heavy less heavy feeling 
anyway I mean let's face it this is this is heavy

you know do the lemon do garlicky buttery and 
so umami from all the trifecta of brown sauces

and then the chewiness of the noodles which 
is perfect a lot of this also has to do with

you choosing the right noodles for this so 
whatever you've got available in your store

it may take you a couple of tries to find 
the one that you really really like so go

fast and go chewy that's my recommendation and 
that is it I hope you give this recipe a try
